channel.title: Spring Framework on Alex T.
channel.description: Recent content in Spring Framework on Alex T.

item.title: Making JSP work with Spring Boot 2
item.description: One of my past projects relied heavily on XML based configurations and JSP technologies dated back to Spring Framework 3.x. It is still working fine after upgrading to Spring 5 and corresponding dependent libraries such as Hibernate 5, HikariCP 3 and Apache CXF 3.

item.title: Tour de Spring Boot: DI meets CoC
item.description: I started using Spring framework few years back in 2009 to develop demo systems for some EU projects. These projects featured a number of Web services some of which share back-end databases and some other talk to external services or WS-BPEL business processes.

item.title: Spring Boot properties issues with trailing whitespaces
item.description: TL;DR:Spring Boot does not trim off the trailing whitespaces in *.properties that in turn might lead to some unexpected errors. As the Spring development team decides to not fix this issue, we can configure code editors to avoid some similar problems.

item.title: Back to basics: Test-driven Spring JDBC
item.description: Spring is a popular heavy-weight framework for developing Java/Groovy based applications. Its rich libraries and software stack can cover from front-end to back-end development. In 2009 I used Spring Framework 3 to develop web services and MVC + Hibernate portal for a fictious loan approval process.

item.title: A journey from Apache CXF 2.2 to 3.2
item.description: I have used Apache CXF 2.2 to develop Web services for some R&D projects that I took part in. At that time, it was a choice between Apache Axis/Axis2 and CXF (formerly Codehaus XFire project).
